channel.title: Feature Announcements on Modern survey data analysis
channel.description: Recent content in Feature Announcements on Modern survey data analysis

item.title: Easily create and recombine categorical arrays and multiple response variables
item.description: Create your own custom combinations to use in both categorical arrays and multiple response variables — available now with Early Access enabled. Click here to learn more.

item.title: Use custom color palettes for your saved analyses
item.description: Create your own palettes of colors to use for dashboard graphs and in exports. Have them automatically applied to new analyses you save to the deck. Click here to learn more.

item.title: Perfect your PowerPoint decks with many new edit controls
item.description: Analyses you save to a deck can now include visual edits to perfect your exported PowerPoint deck. Click here to learn more.

item.title: Show value labels on graphs
item.description: Users can now decide whether to show value labels for graphs and charts, both in Tables & Graphs mode and on dashboards. Click here to learn more.

item.title: Adding KPI tiles to dashboards
item.description: Dataset editors can add KPI tiles to a dashboard to display a single value from a table to highlight or track a specific key metric. Click here to learn more.

item.title: Create the interaction of two variables
item.description: Cross one variable by another to fill all categories in 3 clicks with the new Interaction variable builder.

item.title: Dashboard tabs
item.description: Dataset editors can now add tabs to their dashboards to display analyses on different pages. Click here to learn more.

item.title: Crunch's updated Member panels make it easy to see who has access to a dataset or folder
item.description: You can now see all users who have permissions on a dataset or folder by clicking the name in the header and selecting Members. Click here to learn more.

item.title: Adding rich-text tiles to dashboards
item.description: Dataset editors can add rich-text tiles to a dashboard to display information such as terms and conditions, fieldwork dates, privacy notices, commentary and analysis, or any other content. Click here to learn more.

item.title: Filtering dashboards
item.description: Dataset editors can now specify variables that can be used to filter all analyses in the dashboard at once – let your users customize their view data by gender, age, brand, and more with a single click. Click here to learn more.

item.title: Click to set the comparison column for hypothesis tests
item.description: You can now click to set a reference column for hypothesis testing in tables. Click here to learn more.

item.title: Customizable dashboards
item.description: Crunch dashboards have just had a major upgrade, available now for all dataset editors. Check out all the great customizations you can now make. Click here to learn more.

item.title: New hypothesis testing features in Crunch
item.description: Crunch tab book exports now include a new hypothesis testing option that computes all possible comparisons between columns of a two-way table. Click here to learn more.

item.title: Quick Multitable Export
item.description: Export only what you see to XLSX or use saved settings to include more.

item.title: Improved Organization of Datasets
item.description: We've moved to a folder-based, nested organization for datasets in order to make it easier to navigate and manage permissions on datasets.

item.title: PowerPoint Deck Exports
item.description: Decks can now be downloaded directly to PowerPoint. Click here to learn more.

item.title: Subtotals for Categorical Data
item.description: Enhance your analyses by adding subtotals to your tables. See summary statistics of interest at a glance.

item.title: Introducing Dashboards
item.description: Dashboards provide a clear top-level view of a dataset. Dataset owners can easily customize the contents of the dashboard in order to provide a concise, beautiful summary of key findings.

item.title: Sentiment Analysis
item.description: At the press of a button, you can classify text data with natural language processing.

item.title: Refine your searches on Crunch
item.description: With these new search filters, you can refine your queries and find the datasets or variables you are looking for faster.

item.title: 📊 New Header, New Font, New Graphs 📈
item.description: Our new visual updates make Crunch easier to use and let your data speak more clearly than ever

item.title: Deliver New Data When You’re Ready
item.description: Our new draft-and-publish feature allows you to prepare and review changes to data before pushing them to everyone.

item.title: Tab Book Improvements
item.description: By popular demand, Excel tab books just gained a bunch of new capabilities.
